column2: PMs  -  DEHACKING/PACKAGING SYSTEMS
The dehacking circuit and manual unloading and packaging are comprised of:
1 UNLOADING TURNING TABLE
1 UNLOADING CAR FORK
2 DEHACKING ROBOTS WITH 2 GRIPPERS (2+2 FOR 16")
4 CHAINS CONVEYORS
4 BLENDING GRIPPERS
2 COLOR BLENDING METALLIC SLAT CONVEYOR
2 PACKAGING LINE FEEDING PUSHERS
2 WALKING BEAM TRANSFER
2 DEFACING GRIPPERS
2 CONVEYORS UNDER THE DEFACING GRIPPERS
1 MARSHALLING LINE WITH COUNTING STOP
1 STACKING / FACING GRIPPER WITH PAPER FEEDER
1 CUBING GRIPPER
1 TINE BOARD STORAGE TABLE
1 CUBE LIFTING ROLLER CONVEYOR WITH 2 PUSHERS
4 DESTICKING DEVICE
2 METALLIC LATH CONVEYORS
1 VIADUC BLOCS TRANSFER FORK
1 VIADUC BLOCS BUFFER
1 VACUUM CLEANER WITHOUT VIADUCT BLOCKS LIFTING DEVICE
GENERIC PROCEDURES AND FREQUENCIES
EVERY 160 HOURS
Grease heavily loaded belt bearings.
Check corrects positioning of belts on drums.
Check that waste material does not stick on belt drums.
Clean the product transfer chains and guide rails.
column6: Persons qualified to carry out operations on the installation.

column2: Check the gripper linings used for load handling.
Clean dust from photoelectric cells using an anti static product.
Check the wash pot bleeds on machine supplies.
Fill the air lubrifiers and bleed the filters.
Check the Warlon linings on the packing envelope soldering irons.
Check for correct unwinding of packing envelope material.
Check that there is no material entangled in the trolleys.
Clean the kiln material handling car tracks.
Grease ball guiding.
EVERY 960 HOURS
Lubrication bearings.
Lubrication ball and joint.
Tighten cam rollers and check the sliders.
Check heavy duty motor mountings.
Check heavy duty motor band tension.
Check heavy duty motor brake air gap.
Check transport belt tension.
Clean detector and limit stop detector
Check combustion components of retraction ramp.
Check that cables are correctly wound on the handling car winches.

Check safety components = stroke limiters contacts, safety units, torque limiters, door and gate contacts, safety interlock switch, safety photocells, emergency shut down, safety logic block, contactor, signal and warning mechanism.
EVERY 2000 HOURS
Check the rail mounted gripper guide rollers.
Check the alignment of fixed equipment and mobile equipment (transfer platform, lifting platform, pusher, etc....).
Grease the raise/lower guides.
Grease the slewing rings and pinions.
Grease transmission, lifting and coupling chains.
Check machine components in contact with the product = stops, tipper teeth,....
Check the transporter band joints, Sandwick bands, welded belts,...
Check couplings, the state of transmission belt tensions in general
Check brake gaps on all motors.
Check terminal box mountings on heavy duty motors.
Check the brushes on DC motors.
Check reducer gear unit, Sopap and transmission oil levels.
Check grounding braids on cabinet doors and control panels...
Check the condition of cable sheaths and the cables inside them or on trolleys.
Check the gas circuit on the retraction ramp.
Check the condition of the Vulcolan rollers on the roller track.
Check oil levels in the hydraulic units.
Check for leaks on hydraulic and pneumatic circuits.
Check chain tensions on material handling cars (shifter, pusher,...).
Grease ratchets on kiln handling equipment.
Check for wear on car brakes.
Check kiln door seals.
EVERY 4000 HOURS
Check gripper raise/lower rollers, enveloping packager, retraction oven.
Check ball sockets and transmission shafts.
Check the condition and good working order of reverse lock ratchets.
Check lifting components = pinions, chains, chain attachments, anchor point weldments.
Check the return roller rails and belts.
Make a thorough check of all fasteners.
Check wear of guide bars and transporter bands.
Check the condition of the U gripper handling linings.
Check for play in grippers and linkages.
Tighten all cabinet, junction box and control panel terminals.
Change the oil in reducer units.
Change the oil in hydraulic units.
Check haulage car chains.
Check car, trolley and cable carrier sheaths.
(1) UNLOADING TURNING TABLE
Electrical Remove dust from photoelectric cells using an antistatic product
Electrical Check heavy duty motor mountings
Bearing Lubrication
Ball and joint Lubrication
Vulcolan guide rollers Clean rails. Check rollers.  Adjust play if necessary.  Check parallel movement of carriages
Lubrication Check gear unit, Sopap and transmission unit oil levels
Electrical Check that terminal boxes are correctly attached on heavy duty motors
Electrical Check air gaps on all motors
Belts Check couplings and condition of transmission belt tensions
Mechanical Check all fasteners for tightness
Lubrication Change oil in gear units

Mechanical Check all fasteners for tightness
Lubrication Change oil in gear units
